Synopsis:
Fraud is a tense and seductive thriller about love and loyalty in the world of high finance. The protagonist of the film is Robert Miller (Richard Gere), a tycoon who on the eve of his 60th birthday seems the perfect portrait of American success in their professional and family life, always accompanied by his loyal wife Ellen (Susan Sarandon) and Brooke (Brit Marling), daughter and heir to his empire. But behind the gilded walls of his mansion, Miller is with the water neck, desperate to complete the sale of his empire to a major bank before being exposed to have committed fraud. It also maintains an affair with a French art dealer (Laetitia Casta) behind his wife and daughter. Just as he is about to shed its troubled empire, an unexpected bloody mistake forces you to reconnect with a ghost from her past and confront the limits of their double standards.

Production notes:
Fraud is the feature debut of writer Nicholas Jarecki. This taut and alluring suspense packed thriller about love, loyalty, and high finance will be screened at the opening gala of the 60th San Sebastian Film Festival on 21 September.
